title: Completed PE Summary - Calon Mor
raw_html:
Category Fishing
Registered Owner & Manager: Mrs P Jenkins
Port of registry: Poole
Flag: UK
Type: Potter
Built: 1983
Construction: Wood
Length overall: 11.8
Gross tonnage: 9.29
Date & Time 04/03/06 09:57
Location of incident: Welsh coastal waters
Incident Type: Accident to Person
Persons onboard: 2 crew
Injuries/ fatalities: 1 fatality
Damage/ Pollution: None

Synopsis

The skipper of this 11 metre potter fell overboard while hauling a string of pots. In spite of strenuous efforts, his deckhand was unable to recover him alone. With the help of the skipper of a nearby fishing vessel, the skipper was finally recovered and air lifted to hospital. Unfortunately he lost his life.

Action taken:

The Chief Inspector decided a full investigation was not appropriate. An article will be published on one of MAIB's Safety Digests highlighting the value to fishermen of wearing a lifejacket while on deck.

With the help of the skipper of a nearby fishing vessel, the skipper was finally recovered and air lifted to hospital. Unfortunately he lost his life.
